column2: text
Albion's warriors are known for their fickle nature in fights. As long as their belief in themselves is unbroken, they attack with savage, unrelenting bravery.
War Fury I
Albion's warriors are known for their moody nature in fights. When facing a superior foe or finding themselves on the losing side of a battle, they can lose heart quickly.
War Fury II

Woad Paint is applied by druids. It uses the excess magic of the area to protect the warrior whose skin is painted with it. The stronger the winds of magic in an area, the more effective the paint will be.
Woad Paint
As long as this unit isn't injured too much, they are able to savagely charge their enemies with devastating effect.
Devastating Charge
The magic of Albion conjures the famous mists of its homeland, enveloping allied warriors, protecting them from projectiles.
Mists of Albion
The mage calls upon the gods of hunting and battle to grant his allies additional strength and skill.
Blessing of Valor
Dying Warriors are granted a second chance as the spell of the truthsayer mends their deadly wounds and allows them to return to battle.
Gift of Life
A barrier of shimmering light protects the warriors from magic and flame alike.
Light of Protection
The booming voice of the truthsayer fills the mind of an enemy, robbing them of the concentration necessary to operate ranged weapons.
Voice of Command
The voice of the truthsayer is heard in the minds of his warriors, invoking their sense of honor and giving them unwavering hope and toughness even in the most desperate of situations.
Boon of Courage
The Truthsayer conjures a flock of magical birds which will fly straight into the enemy formations, bringing doom to those they collide with.
Wings of Fate
Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.
Awakening of the Wood
The mage calls upon the gods of hunting and battle to grant his allies the ability to fight with unnatural strength and fearsome savagery.
Blessing of Valor (upgraded)
Dying Warriors are granted a second chance as the spell of the truthsayer mends their deadly wounds and allows them to return to battle.
Gift of Life (upgraded)
A barrier of shimmering light protects the warriors from magic and flame alike.
Light of Protection (upgraded)
The booming voice of the truthsayer fills the mind of an enemy, robbing them of the concentration necessary to operate ranged weapons.
Voice of Command (upgraded)
The voice of the truthsayer is heard in the minds of his warriors, invoking their sense of honor and giving them unwavering hope even in the most desperate of situations.
Boon of Courage (upgraded)
The Truthsayer conjures a flock of magic bird which will fly straight into the enemy formations, bringing doom to those they collide with.
Wings of Fate (upgraded)
These unnatural creatures require magic to exist - the more the better. If the winds of magic blow strongly, they are more stable on the battlefield.
Magic Dependant
Fen Hulks are embodiments of the corrupted lands of Albion. Wherever they go, the land is corrupted into muddy bogs which greatly hinder their enemies.
Embodiment of Albion
Only the best warleaders mastered the art of motivating their warriors to fight even harder with nothing more than a single, mighty cry of defiance.
Warcry
Those who stand against Morrigan have a feeling of their impending doom. Some say it is simply a glimpse into their near future.
Omen of Doom
Morrigan's allies fight harder in her presence because they know about the importance of the battle if even the Phantom Queen takes part in it.
Omen of War
Morrigan's flock of crows follows her everywhere and will attack each and any enemy coming close to her.
Murder of Crows
Howling Shields
Howling Shields are a speciality of the warriors of the Fir Domain. They are constructed in such a way that air passing through the shields produces a frightening howling sound.
Morrigan's ravens cloud the skies, circling above the battlefield and attacking every enemy who dares to take to the air.
Darkened Skies
Morrigan conjures a flock of magical birds which will fly straight into the enemy formations, bringing doom to those they collide with.
Wings of Fate (bound)
Morrigan's flock of ravens follows her everywhere and will attack each and any enemy coming close to her, aiming for their eyes and attacking them without pause or remorse.
Goddess of Ravens
It is said that Huntresses who follow Morrigan have to hunt an eagle to obtain its eyes for themselves, allowing them to hit the most difficult targets from afar.
Eagle's Eyes
Holy Zeal
These warriors put their trust into their gods and will attack relentlessly without fear unless they are decimated enough to lose some of that trust in divine protection.
Protectors of the World
If we can't save the world, no one can.
Imperfect Shield of the Old Ones
Dural Durak has more insight into the secrets of the Old Ones than any other human alive, but even his knowledge is but an incomplete reflection of the truth, tainted by the passing of the ages.
Staff of Dural Durak
The Staff of Dural Durak twists the winds of magic in a unique way, making it difficult for enemy casters to utilize them.
Call of the Fens
Usually, it takes preparation and a lengthy ritual to produce fenbeasts, but Dural Durak is able to create them during battles when needed. None of the other Truthsayers knows how.
Amulet of the Old Ones

One of the few surviving artifacts of the Old Ones still in the hands of the people of Albion, this amulet unleashes a wave of magic into the air, healing its wearer and saturating the area with magic. After each activation, the item has to rest for a long time until it has recharged enough to be used again.
Through sheer willpower, they will continue fighting with their body ravaged by wounds until the independence of Albion is protected and secured.
Freedom!
The strongest Giant of Albion is almost as revered as a minor deity by Albion's inhabitants. His appearence of the battlefield raises the spirit of all who fight on his side.
Greatest Champion of Albion

Just like most Albion Giants, Bologs intellect leaves a lot to desire. His name is the only word he speaks and doubles as his warcry when Bologs gets angry. And you really don't want Bologs to get angry.
Bologs, Bologs, BOLOGS!

In their time as mercenaries, lost in the lands of Tilea, Hengus the Druid would guide Bologs and his brother. Hengus is far too old now to take to the battlefield himself, but he will still prepare the giant brothers with the last of his feeble magic for the battles ahead.
Hengus' Blessing
These warriors have focused on proving their worth on the battlefield. As long as their will is unbroken, they will push themselves beyond their limits.
Something to Prove
